[[Tres Cantos]], [[Community of Madrid|Madrid]] | locations = | area_served = | key_people = | industry = | products = | services = Television broadcasting | revenue = | operating_income = | net_income = | aum = | assets = | equity = | owner = | num_employees = | parent = | divisions = | subsid = | homepage = | footnotes = | intl = }} '''Sociedad General de TelevisiÃ³n Cuatro, S.A.U.''', better known by their trade name '''Sogecuatro''', was a [[Spain|Spanish]] media company that operated the Spanish television channel [[Cuatro (TV channel)|Cuatro]]. It operated as a subsidiary of the audiovisual division ([[Sogecable]]) of the Spanish media conglomerate [[PRISA]]. On May 28, 2010 the [[Council of Ministers of Spain|Council of Ministers]] authorised the transfer of the broadcasting license from Sogecable to their subsidiary.{{Cite web|url=http://www.elmundo.es/elmundo/2010/05/28/comunicacion/1275056688.html|title=El Gobierno autoriza a Sogecable a ceder Sogecuatro su licencia de TV|publisher=El Mundo|language=Spanish}} On December 28, 2010 parent company [[Sogecable|PRISA TV]] sold Sogecuatro to GestevisiÃ³n Telecinco, now known as [[Mediaset EspaÃ±a ComunicaciÃ³n|Mediaset EspaÃ±a]], for 485 million euros and a 17.3% stake in the buying company.{{Cite web|url=http://www.elmundo.es/elmundo/2010/12/28/comunicacion/1293533459.html|title=Prisa da entrada a Telecinco y TelefÃ³nica en Digital + con el 22% cada una|publisher=El Mundo|language=Spanish}} ==References== {{reflist}} {{Telecinco}} [[Category:Companies based in the Community of Madrid]] [[Category:Companies established in 2010]] [[Category:Companies disestablished in 2011]] [[Category:Spanish brands]]
